thread.title: MTSU: Bryson will play against FIU
thread.title_full: MTSU: Bryson will play against FIU

title: MTSU: Bryson will play against FIU
text:
MTSU: Bryson will play against FIU Aldo Giovanni Amato, agamato@dnj.com 6:12 p.m. CDT October 15, 2015 Jeremiah Bryson 7 CONNECT 8 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
MURFREESBORO — MTSU running back Jeremiah Bryson, charged twice last weekend, will play Saturday, The Daily News Journal confirmed Thursday afternoon. 
Bryson, 23, was charged in two separate incidents, law enforcement officials with Rutherford County and the town of Smyrna told The Daily News Journal on Tuesday. 
Mark Owens, MTSU’s associate athletics director for communications, said Wednesday that Bryson was cleared to play in Saturday's game against Florida International. 
Owens Thursday did not provide any additional comment beyond confirming Bryson's status for Saturday. 
According to a Smyrna Police Department arrest report, Bryson was charged Sunday with simple assault from an incident Oct. 8. 
After Bryson was booked in Smyrna, SPD found an attachment order for failure to pay child support in the system. Bryson was then transferred by a Rutherford County deputy to the Rutherford County Adult Detention Center, according to the Smyrna arrest report. Details emerge in Bryson arrest 
Head coach Rick Stockstill addressed the child-support arrest early Tuesday in a statement to The Daily News Journal. 
"It's a personal matter, and it is my understanding that Jeremiah and his family have handled the situation," Stockstill said in a statement, Bryson was present at Tuesday's practice. 
After practice Tuesday, Stockstill said he was surprised by the news of the simple-assault charge. 
"This is news to me, and it's different than what I talked about earlier Tuesday," Stockstill said. "I don't know all the facts, and I'm anxious to read the (police) report." 
Stockstill has not commented further on the charges. 
The Daily News Journal requested an interview with Bryson, the university declined. 
Bryson, a Smyrna native is currently second on the Blue Raiders in rushing yards (186) and rushing touchdowns (three). 
Bryson has also accumulated 427 yards on 18 kickoff returns this season.
